an3.104:4.1: “Mendicants, I went in search of the world’s gratification,
an3.104:4.3: I’ve seen clearly with wisdom the full extent of gratification in the world.
an3.104:4.4: I went in search of the world’s drawback,
an3.104:4.6: I’ve seen clearly with wisdom the full extent of the drawback in the world.
an3.104:4.7: I went in search of escape from the world,
an3.104:4.9: I’ve seen clearly with wisdom the full extent of escape from the world.
an3.104:4.10: As long as I didn’t truly understand the world’s gratification, drawback, and escape for what they are, I didn’t announce my supreme perfect awakening in this world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans.
an3.104:4.11: But when I did truly understand the world’s gratification, drawback, and escape for what they are, I announced my supreme perfect awakening in this world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans.
an3.104:4.12: Knowledge and vision arose in me:
an3.104:4.13: ‘My freedom is unshakeable; this is my final birth; now there are no more future lives.’”
